properties.areaDesc: Central Interior; Middle Tanana Valley; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands; Eastern Alaska Range; Denali; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Deltana and Tanana Flats
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 9 at 5:07AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks AK
properties.description:
The cold over interior Alaska will linger into Saturday, then
warming temperatures late Saturday and Sunday.

The upper level ridge to the west, and the cold trough to the
east that is digging west over the Central and Eastern Interior
will move east Saturday allowing warmer air to push north and east
into the Interior.

Temperatures through Saturday will remain below normal with the
daily highs not much warmer than the lows. Some warmer air moving
in aloft will not impact surface temperatures significantly, but
will make inversions stronger in the valleys.

Winds will be picking up on summits along the Elliott and Dalton
Highways today with Wind Chill around 55 below expected. Blowing
and drifting snow is also expected and may impact travel over the
summits. Winds also increasing around Delta Junction, the Tanana
Flats, and near Alaska Range Passes will bring Wind Chill as low
as 55 below to those areas.

For the latest forecasts go to www.weather.gov/fairbanks.
